basics.name: John Quiller
basics.label: Illustrator & Musician
basics.summary:
Born and raised Avengaali in the small town of Hawking I've always had a penchant for the creative. Over the years I focused that creativity into graphical artistry and music. A long time was spent honing those skills. And I like being bold in my creations, pushing the envelope and trying new things. Whatever you make it should have the goal of leaving a lasting impression, even if it is just a small ad on the bottom of the page.

I like a good challenge and trying to not get too comfortable so over the years I've had a wide array of different contracts. Music may have been where I started but even if music may not be my main focus during work I still try to keep my skills refined during my free time. And the future looks bright with new hard tasks to wrestle with and solve.

experience.summary: Creating illustrations and doing layout for ads, pamphlets, etc. Has worked for the state, ElectroNics United and DrillDen Inc. Worked closely with customers, empowering them to make decisions that lends themselves to great graphical designs. And doing this in a timely and cost-efficient manner.

Designing user interfaces for breaking edge web-applications in economics and industry. High-traffic applications that require efficient and easy to use solutions. Often shorter prototype contracts requiring a fast turnaround yet without a lack in quality.

Drawing artwork for childrens books in a style that both delights and intrigues the child. Helped with some layout and formatting as well. Included work with larger books with popup art with a 3D design.

Part-time work creating musical scores for films, TV as well as some small work for radio. Worked with both independent filmmakers as well as larger more established filmstudios. Had access to a full studio with incredibly modern setups and the best 16 instruments with mixing help from the studio.

projects.name: Avengaal Post
projects.summary: One of the latest editions I helped create ads and layout for.
